1041.original:
H-0073.1
HOUSE BILL 1041
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByRepresentatives Walsh and Jacobsen
Prefiled 12/11/24.Read first time 01/13/25.Referred to Committee on Environment & Energy.
AN ACT Relating to improving choices of replacement tires for consumers; reenacting and amending RCW 70A.30.010; adding a new section to chapter 70A.05 RCW; adding a new section to chapter 70A.45 RCW; adding a new chapter to Title 19 RCW; and creating a new section.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 1. The legislature recognizes that Washington has a target of zero injuries and deaths for users of its roadways and transportation system. Replacement tires with increased tread and durability are important options in helping provide increased safety for drivers in rugged, wet, or icy conditions. The federal government is responsible for the motor vehicle standards, including tires. Therefore, state and local governments may not restrict the manufacture, use, or sale of tires that are in compliance with the federal motor vehicle safety standards prescribed pursuant to 49 U.S.C. Sec. 30111. The legislature is protecting the freedom of choice for people to purchase and use tires they want that meet federal motor vehicle safety standards.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 2. (1) Any person may manufacture, use, or sell passenger vehicle tires within the state that are in compliance with the federal motor vehicle safety standards prescribed pursuant to 49 U.S.C. Sec. 30111.
(2) State agencies and local governmental agencies may not issue rules that restrict or ban the manufacture, sale, or use of tires based on their energy efficiency or rolling resistance rating.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 3. A new section is added to chapter 70A.05 RCW to read as follows:
State and local governmental agencies shall not restrict or regulate the use or sale of tires under this chapter.
Sec. 4. RCW 70A.30.010 and 2020 c 143 s 1 and 2020 c 20 s 1366 are each reenacted and amended to read as follows:
(1) Pursuant to the federal clean air act, the legislature adopts the California motor vehicle emission standards in Title 13 of the California Code of Regulations. ((The))Except as provided for in subsection (3) of this section, the department of ecology shall adopt rules to implement the motor vehicle emission standards of the state of California, including the zero emission vehicle program, and shall amend the rules from time to time, to maintain consistency with the California motor vehicle emission standards and 42 U.S.C. Sec. 7507 (section 177 of the federal clean air act).
(2) The provisions of this chapter do not apply with respect to the use by a resident of this state of a motor vehicle acquired and used while the resident is a member of the armed services and is stationed outside this state pursuant to military orders.
(3) The department may not adopt restrictions on the manufacture, sale, or use of vehicle tires even if the California Code of Regulations includes such restrictions.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 5. A new section is added to chapter 70A.45 RCW to read as follows:
State and local governmental agencies shall not restrict or regulate the use or sale of tires under this chapter as part of a greenhouse gases reduction strategy.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 6. Section 2 of this act constitutes a new chapter in Title 19 RCW.
--- END ---
1041.summary:
Purpose

The purpose of this bill is to enhance consumer choices regarding replacement tires in Washington State, ensuring that these choices contribute to road safety. The bill establishes that state and local governments cannot impose restrictions on tires that meet federal safety standards, particularly regarding their energy efficiency or rolling resistance ratings. This aims to maintain consumer freedom while also addressing safety for drivers in difficult conditions.

Key Provisions

Tire Manufacturing and Sales

  • Any person can manufacture, use, or sell passenger vehicle tires that comply with federal motor vehicle safety standards.
  • State and local agencies may not issue rules that restrict or ban the manufacture, sale, or use of tires based on energy efficiency or rolling resistance ratings.

Restrictions on Regulation

  • State and local governmental agencies shall not restrict or regulate the use or sale of tires under specified chapters.
  • New sections prohibit restrictions related to the sale or use of tires as a part of greenhouse gas reduction strategies.

Reenactment and Amendment of Existing Law

  • The bill reenacts and amends existing regulations to reaffirm that the Department of Ecology cannot adopt restrictions on tire manufacture, sale, or use even if such restrictions exist in the California Code of Regulations.

This legislation aims to ensure that all tire options available to consumers are safe and compliant with federal standards without unnecessary state-imposed limitations.
